attributes.action: defend Gary McKinnon against the US extradition attempt.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The brow-beating of the UK Home Office by the US authorities is the same action that took the UK into the Iraq war. The UK Government's lack of action makes every UK citizen wonder what protection is provided by their own government.
Alan Johnson, the Home Secretary, when he was a union official, would not have tolerated such treatment of one of his union members and would have fought to mount a strenuous defence.

rejection.details: The Home Secretary does not have general discretion in this case. He can only stop extradition if he finds that McKinnon’s human rights would be breached.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
